page.title: 11CLEEVE COMMON
page.content: THIS PART OF THE COMMON IS VERY STEEP IN PLACES. PEOPLE WALK THEIR DOGS AND RIDE HORSES WHILE SHEEP QUIETLY GRAZE AROUND THE DISUSED QUARRIES. ON THE HIGHER, FLATTER GROUND GOLFERS ENJOY THE BEAUTIFULLY SITED BUT EXPOSED GOLF COURSE. THE POSTLIP VALLEY IS A WIDE EXPANSE OF SHELTERED DOWNLAND WITH DEEP VALLEYS .AT POSTLIP ABOVE A SMALL POND KNOWN AS THE WASHPOOL THERE IS A SPRING THAT RARELY DRIES UP BECAUSE OF THE POROUS SAND AND LIMESTONE SOIL.THE STREAM RUNS THROUGH AN OLD SHEEPDIP.A PAPER MILL AT POSTLIP HAS MADE FILTER PAPERS SINCE THE 18TH CENTURY. POSTLIP WARREN IS REACHED BY A LONG AVENUE OF TREES. A ROMAN CATHOLIC CHAPEL IN THE GROUNDS IS OF OF THE NORMAN PERIOD.IT WAS RESTORED IN THE 19TH CENTURY.
